data.title: Smelly Clothes
data.statement:
You are an extraordinarily intelligent washing machine that can recognize articles of clothing as they are put inside you. You must determine how many days your operator can last after doing laundry inside of you.

Every day requires one set of clothing comprising exactly the following articles and nothing else: {{1}} [[SHIRT]], {{1}} [[JEANS]], <<any>> {{2}} [[SOCK]]s, and {{1}} [[SWEATER]]. An item is classified as one of these articles if the description contains the name <<(CASE INSENSITIVE)>> of the class (e.g. {{Black Shirt}} is a [[SHIRT]]).

Some classes of clothing last longer than others. [[SOCK]]s and [[SHIRT]]s last {{1}} day, while [[JEANS]] last {{2}} days and [[SWEATER]]s last {{3}} days.

data.constraints:
1 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 100
1 ≤ Length of [[S]] ≤ 50
[[S]] will classify to <<at most>> one of [[SHIRT]], [[JEANS]], [[SOCK]] or [[SWEATER]]
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loop N read item:string(64)
write At least a week?
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] representing the number of items (all recently cleaned) inside of you.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> A string [[S]] describing the clean item.
data.outputDescription: An integer representing the number of days that the provided list of items can last.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are an extraordinarily intelligent washing machine that can recognize articles of clothing as they are put inside you. You must determine how many days your operator can last after doing laundry inside of you.

Every day requires one set of clothing comprising exactly the following articles and nothing else: 1 SHIRT, 1 JEANS, any 2 SOCKs, and 1 SWEATER. An item is classified as one of these articles if the description contains the name (CASE INSENSITIVE) of the class (e.g. Black Shirt is a SHIRT).

Some classes of clothing last longer than others. SOCKs and SHIRTs last 1 day, while JEANS last 2 days and SWEATERs last 3 days.
Input
Line 1: An integer N representing the number of items (all recently cleaned) inside of you.
Next N lines: A string S describing the clean item.
Output
An integer representing the number of days that the provided list of items can last.
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 100
1 ≤ Length of S ≤ 50
S will classify to at most one of SHIRT, JEANS, SOCK or SWEATER
Example
Input
25
White Shirt
White Jeans
White Sock
White Sock
White Sweater
Black Shirt
Black Jeans
Black Sock
Black Sock
Black Sweater
Blue Shirt
Blue Jeans
Blue Sock
Blue Sock
Blue Sweater
Red Shirt
Red Jeans
Red Sock
Red Sock
Red Sweater
Green Shirt
Green Jeans
Green Sock
Green Sock
Green Sweater
Output
5
